com.esri.mo2.cs.geom
Class BaseTransform

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.cs.geom.BaseTransform
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, Transform
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseDisplayTransform
public class BaseTransform
extends Object
implements Transform

This is the standard implementation of the Transform interface.

Constructor Summary
BaseTransform()
          Constructs a "unity" transform.
BaseTransform(AffineTransform a)
          Constructs a new Transform based on a Java AffineTransform.
BaseTransform(double f, double x, double y)
          Constructs a transform with equal scales in both the x and y directions.

Constructor Detail

BaseTransform

public BaseTransform()
Constructs a "unity" transform.

BaseTransform

public BaseTransform(AffineTransform a)
Constructs a new Transform based on a Java AffineTransform. The transform is checked to ensure that the Yscale equals the Xscale.

Parameters:
a - the AffineTransform
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the scale requirement is invalid

BaseTransform

public BaseTransform(double f,
                     double x,
                     double y)
Constructs a transform with equal scales in both the x and y directions.

Parameters:
f - common x and y scale
x - translation value
y - translation value

Description copied from interface: Transform

translate

public Transform translate(double tx,
                           double ty)
Description copied from interface: Transform
Creates a new Transform by applying a translation transformation to the current Transform. The transformation is defined by: 
		[   1    0    tx  ]
		[   0    1    ty  ]
		[   0    0    1   ]

Specified by:
translate in interface Transform
See Also:
AffineTransform.translate(double, double)

scale

public Transform scale(double s)
Description copied from interface: Transform
Creates a new Transform by applying a scaling transformation to the current Transform. The transformation is defined by: 
		[   s    0    0   ]
		[   0    s    0   ]
		[   0    0    1   ]

Specified by:
scale in interface Transform
See Also:
AffineTransform.translate(double, double)

transform

public Point transform(Point w,
                       Point p)
Description copied from interface: Transform
Transforms a source point to a target point. If a target point object is given, then the result is placed there, else a new point object is created. Either way the result is returned.

Specified by:
transform in interface Transform
Parameters:
w - the source point
p - the target point, or null
Returns:
the transformed point

Specified by:
distance in interface Transform
Parameters:
d - the distance value
Returns:
the transformed distance
